Past simple.english: He cut his finger while cooking.

You will be contacted soon.

Past continuous.english: I was working at 6 PM yesterday.
She was studying when I called.
We were watching TV all evening.
They were traveling around Italy last summer.

Past continuous.english: He was cooking dinner while she was setting the table.
Past continuous.russian: Он готовил ужин, пока она накрывала на стол.

Past continuous.english: It was raining when we left the house.
Past continuous.russian: Шёл дождь, когда мы вышли из дома.

Past continuous.english: I wasn't sleeping at that time.
Past continuous.russian: Я не спал в то время.

Past continuous.english: What were you doing at the moment of the accident?
Past continuous.russian: Что ты делал в момент аварии?

Past continuous (passive).english: The road was being repaired all week.
A new bridge was being built when I visited the city.
Past continuous (passive).russian: Новый мост строили, когда я посещал город.

Past continuous (passive).english: My computer was being fixed yesterday afternoon.
Past continuous (passive).russian: Мой компьютер вчера после обеда чинили.

Past continuous (passive).english: The documents were being prepared for the meeting.
Dinner was being served when we arrived.

Past perfect.english: I had finished my work before they came.
Past perfect.russian: Я закончил свою работу до того, как они пришли.

Past perfect.english: She had already left when I called.
Past perfect.russian: Она уже ушла, когда я позвонил.

Past perfect.english: We realized we had lost the keys.
He had never seen such a beautiful place before.
Past perfect.russian: Он никогда раньше не видел такого красивого места.

Past perfect.english: After they had eaten, they went for a walk.
Past perfect.russian: После того как они поели, они пошли гулять.

Past perfect (passive).english: The letter had been sent before we found the mistake.
Past perfect (passive).russian: Письмо было отправлено до того, как мы нашли ошибку.

Past perfect (passive).english: The car had been repaired by the end of the day.
Past perfect (passive).russian: Машина была отремонтирована к концу дня.

Past perfect (passive).english: He was upset because his idea hadn't been accepted.
Past perfect (passive).russian: Он был расстроен, потому что его идея не была принята.

Past perfect (passive).english: Had the room been cleaned before the guests arrived?
Past perfect (passive).russian: Комната была убрана до прихода гостей?

Past perfect (passive).english: All the tickets had been sold by the time we got there.
Past perfect (passive).russian: Все билеты были проданы к тому времени, как мы туда добрались.

Past perfect continuous.english: I had been working for 10 hours when you called.
Past perfect continuous.russian: Я проработал уже 10 часов, когда ты позвонил.

Past perfect continuous.english: She was tired because she had been studying all day.
Past perfect continuous.russian: Она устала, потому что училась весь день.

Past perfect continuous.english: They had been waiting for over an hour before the bus finally came.
Past perfect continuous.russian: Они ждали больше часа, прежде чем автобус наконец приехал.

Past perfect continuous.english: How long had you been living there before you moved?
Past perfect continuous.russian: Как долго ты там жил, прежде чем переехал?

Past perfect continuous.english: His eyes were red. He had been crying.
Past perfect continuous.russian: Его глаза были красными. Он плакал.

Future continuous.english: At this time tomorrow, I will be flying to London.
Future continuous.russian: В это же время завтра я буду лететь в Лондон.

Future continuous.english: Don't call between 6 and 8, we will be having dinner.
Future continuous.russian: Не звони между 6 и 8, мы будем ужинать.

Future continuous.english: This time next week, she will be starting her new job.
Future continuous.russian: В это же время на следующей неделе она будет начинать свою новую работу.

Future continuous.english: Will you be using the car tonight?
Future continuous.russian: Ты будешь пользоваться машиной сегодня вечером?

Future continuous.english: I won't be working next Friday.
Future continuous.russian: Я не буду работать в следующую пятницу.

Future perfect.english: By next year, I will have finished my degree.
Future perfect.russian: К следующему году я закончу свою степень.

Future perfect.english: They will have built the house by summer.
She will have left by the time you get there.
Future perfect.russian: Она уже уедет к тому времени, как ты туда доберёшься.

Future perfect.english: Will you have saved enough money by December?
Future perfect.russian: Ты накопишь достаточно денег к декабрю?

Future perfect.english: We won't have completed the report by Friday.
Future perfect.russian: Мы не завершим отчёт к пятнице.

Future perfect (passive).english: The new stadium will have been built by the start of the championship.
Future perfect (passive).russian: Новый стадион будет построен к началу чемпионата.

Future perfect (passive).english: All the invitations will have been sent out by tomorrow.
Future perfect (passive).russian: Все приглашения будут разосланы к завтрашнему дню.

Future perfect (passive).english: Will the preparations have been finished by noon?
The decision will have been made by the board before the meeting.
Future perfect (passive).russian: Решение будет принято советом до собрания.

Future perfect continuous.english: By the end of this month, I will have been working here for 5 years.
Future perfect continuous.russian: К концу этого месяца я буду работать здесь уже 5 лет.

Future perfect continuous.english: In July, they will have been living in Paris for a decade.
Future perfect continuous.russian: В июле они будут жить в Париже уже десятилетие.

Future perfect continuous.english: She will have been studying English for 10 hours by tonight.
Future perfect continuous.russian: К сегодняшнему вечеру она будет учить английский уже 10 часов.

Future perfect continuous.english: How long will you have been driving when we arrive?
Future perfect continuous.russian: Сколько ты уже будешь за рулём, когда мы приедем?
